Articles.Content:
After watching 2001: A Space Odyssey and followed by SpaceBalls. The film->Kerbal effect got me wondering if there are any huge maxed Kerbal cruisers. The longest biggest baDass ship in Kerbal.

Now diameter is important so ratio of L:D should be noted.

Vessels can be space dock assembled or launched whole from anyplace.

List mods that were used.

Launching parts the Kerbal way = baDass

Behemoths must travell in space like bricks don't and must look very cool.

Here is an SSTO Dreadnaught it's pretty badass - I entered it in the Launcherception challenge and I'm currently 3rd on the leader board. I don't know the exact dimensions but the part count is over 700.

Here are all the pictures I've compiled while working on the Dreadnaught SSTO...

All KSP images have been moved here.

JR

Edited September 28, 2015 by Jolly_Roger
This is a forum announcement. Would Whackjob please report to the Challenges forum. That's Whackjob to the Challenges forum. Thank you.

Who's Whackjob?

JR

Edited August 18, 2014 by Jolly_Roger

If you don't have any thing useful to contribute to this discussion I suggest that you go play somewhere else.

JR

Cantab was just making a joke... sheesh
So was I didn't you find it funny?! ROTFLAFAO!!!!!!!!

I call this one Unari...

All KSP images have been moved here.

Here's the craft file if you want to try it out.

Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/4f3k501dua...ari%20SSTO.zip

It looks really great and geet's into space OK, but other than that it's pretty useless for the most part. It makes for great target practice though - lots of parts, blows up real nice!

Also word of advice, If your gonna deal with space pirates, you better be armed.

JR

Edited September 28, 2015 by Jolly_Roger

Here is an SSTO Dreadnaught it's pretty badass - I entered it in the Launcherception challenge and I'm currently 3rd on the leader board. I don't know the exact dimensions but the part count is over 700 and the rest of the stats are in the Imgur slide show.

You can see it here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/90394-Launcher-ception/page2

http://i.imgur.com/y7fgkYN.png

That thing is almost a battlestar!

385t payload in orbit, 485t on the pad. 24 boost engines mounted radially (ejected while still suborbital so they burn up) and a 12 minute RCS burn for orbital insertion. Plenty power (nuclear and solar), crew capacity: 49, 6 Clamptron docking ports. I wasted nearly 4 tons with KAS gear, because my KAS version doesn't actually work with 23.5(!), but my next big launch will be about three times the size with eight times the crew capacity.

EDIT: well, I tried, but it seems that my poor little laptop can't handle a mere 1900 parts (mostly struts!). That was a 2,000t monster with a crew of 967.

Edited August 18, 2014 by ihtoit
